storyInfo: Ines breaks into the airship alone, and abducts Paprika. Encircled by Manfred, she leaps off the airship, and sounds out a warning to the dukes.

attributes.content: Hmph. I'm starting to regret this.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Sneaking in here... was not a good idea.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The higher the place, the more complete and larger the shadows are.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But this place is a little too high up...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Can you let me go?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: No can do, girlie.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Don't you get any funny ideas either.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This ship is way too big. I'd really appreciate a cute girl helping me keep an eye out for any soldiers popping up.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Do you also call yourself a Victorian Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: No, I'm a Kazdel Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Wait, but... if you're a Kazdel Sarkaz...? Then why are you...?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Aren't you working for General Manfred and the Military Commission?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I work only for myself.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Where's this ship headed?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I don't like seeing kids suffer.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I really don't!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: What exactly is your job here?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Um... being a Sarkaz mercenary?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Heh. A Sarkaz mercenary who hasn't killed before.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You can't even silently draw your weapon while being captured.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's Manfred even planning to do here? Open a kindergarten?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: General Manfred says he wants me to learn what war is.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Well, how's that going?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I think it's just people killing another group of people.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Congratulations, we share the same view.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This ship sure flies high.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The General says it's because it's a revenant.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Ugh. A revenant. So that's why.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's why Ascalon was in so much pain. Good thing they're conspicuous.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This ship is still ascending.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Judging by our heading... it's not flying towards the battlefield. This ship is returning to Londinium.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You flew out of Londinium, fired a shot at the Duke's warship, and then stopped for a few days in Norport Borough.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And now that the dukes are on their way with their fleets, you're retreating?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Seems like I need to change my impression of Manfred. Not only is he passionate about pedagogy, but he likes to take the ship out for little drives too?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Alright, you don't know anything at all.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's your name?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Paprika.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: So you're the Paprika mentioned in the report I read. You freed the workers from Munitions Factory No. 11, and then you were caught by Manfred.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: For a Sarkaz mercenary, is that... not honorable?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: For a Sarkaz mercenary, honor is the worst kind of shame.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You've been to Kazdel before, right? What is it like?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: My old captain told me that it's our homeland.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Where did you grow up?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Columbia.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: No wonder.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Every Sarkaz that hasn't been to Kazdel thinks it's probably an adorable, sweet little place.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's just your own wishful thinking.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Think of the filthiest, most disgusting, any derogatory adjective you can muster, and multiply that by a hundred—now that's Kazdel.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Sounds like most people wouldn't like it.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Then why... why do so many Sarkaz call it home?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Because they need a home.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: They think, as long as they have a home, everything will fall neatly into place, all discrimination and persecution against them will cease and they'll once again be able to puff out their chests in pride.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph. It's silly.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Or maybe you think that... because you're not a Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You like to ask questions, little girl, but that's not a good habit in wartime.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I... I was only making a guess! Please don't get angry!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: ...I'm just real curious.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Nobody here wants to talk to me, and General Manfred is always busy.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: They're all so excited and always talk about doing great things... but why don't I feel it?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: All I've seen is familiar faces dying one by one, getting replaced by fresh faces, but when those become familiar...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: The same thing just happens again and again.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I feel like I shouldn't be here at all.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Does it actually matter if someone is really a Sarkaz or not?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: If everyone thinks you're a Sarkaz, then you might as well grind down your horns and pretend to be one.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Because you can only survive as a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And when it comes to surviving, your feelings don't matter at all.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And that's why you joined this war with the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Seems like you should stay with Manfred a while longer. He hasn't taught you the most important things you need to know about war.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: General Manfred lent me a book, A History of Sarkaz War.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I know the author. His name is Hoederer, and he's an idiot.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: 'Sarkaz War,' 'Victorian War,' 'Ducal War,' 'Royal Court War,' only an idiot talks about stuff like that.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Who'd be arrogant enough to claim a war for themselves? I sure wouldn't, at least.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: War is war, and that's all there is to it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You don't believe this war can save us all... Then what do you believe in?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I believe when you're hungry, you have to eat, when you're thirsty, you need to drink, swinging your arms around for too long will tire you out, and if I jump out of this ship I will die.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I only believe in these things that can't be given meaning.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Toying around with 'meaning' is the root of all suffering.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: In the same way, I believe that profits make people impulsive, fear makes them impatient, a burning fire can not be easily extinguished, and the resulting conflicts cannot be easily ended.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ines, as a guest, you should have greeted me first.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It's been a while, Manfred.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Indeed it has.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: So, why don't you stay? You can admire the scenery with us.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The storm is approaching quickly.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ines and Manfred turn to look out the window.
They see the smoke and dust rising in the distance, and several high-speed battleship fleets approaching.
This airship high up in the sky is attracting the attention of every ducal force already stationed nearby.
A sudden flash of clarity shoots through Ines upon seeing these little battleships scrambling like insects in the shadow of the airship.
You want the flames.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, the flames have already been ignited, you're just... using this ship as kindling to keep it in the air.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Caster, Wellington, Windermere, and maybe Normandy too...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The representatives of these greedy dukes are already all gathered on this plate, while their masters' fleets observe their rivals as they make their way here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This airship is moving so slowly because you're waiting for them, you're tempting them.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The dukes would rather not let the airship hide behind Londinium's robust city walls, so they'll gather here...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And this is what you've all been waiting for.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: An perfectly little... shooting gallery for The Shard.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Should I be glad that Hoederer's partner is so sharp?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: A shame you put it together so late.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Men, seize her.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: So what did she tell you, Paprika?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: She said, war is war, and that's all there is to it.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Indeed, that's all.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: If she could just see the big picture, just how many things surrounding war would she see?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This intelligence must be delivered.
Ines has to admit that the Military Commission has drawn up a brilliant plan.
She can foresee what will happen next.
The Shard's Catastrophe will severely damage the dukes' forces, and furthermore, said damage will be credited to not just the Sarkaz, but also to their respective rivals.
And once Victoria's storm-bringing prowess is drawn out into the open, any country across the lands will feel fear, and also fury.
Every seat of power will want to destroy this one, or possess it for themselves.
What if, at this time—the dukes guarding the borders slack on their duties because of their infighting?
Leithanien, Ursus, Kazimierz, and even the old Gaulish regions would never let this opportunity slip.
This is only the first flame.
Soon, an unstoppable blaze will sweep across the entire land.
Ines knows, there is still time, it's not too late.
As long as she can get the information out—
A shadow approaches at the end of the corridor. It is not her own shadow, but the owner of this vessel.
Ines, who has heard rumors from her old partner about the revenant, is for the first time in her life glad that she isn't a real Sarkaz.
Yep, shadow's still there.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The sun rises, the long night having finally passed, and the mobile plate below her casts an extremely long shadow.
...Right.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I should thank myself for finding such a high place.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'm guessing that a jump from here would probably kill me.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Heh, who would have thought that today, the Ines who always comes back from the brink of death, is finally embracing it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hoederer and W are gonna laugh themselves to death.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I hope they don't get to see me in such a wretched state.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: —*exhale*
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She falls, a gale blowing through her hair, and she can hardly keep her eyes open.
But it is only at this height that she can take all the shadows of Norport into her view.
Only at this height can she manipulate these shadows that stretch as far as she can see.
She knows that she only has a few seconds to make it, quickly falling into the shadows before her.
Now.
Death is already lingering beyond the door.
